conversations.content: Am I free for lunch at 12:00 on 2024-05-19? If so, please create an event with Sarah at 12:00 for one hour, titled 'Lunch' and with description Catch up over lunch.. Her email address is 'sarah.connor@gmail.com'.

<function_thought>
To determine if Emma is free for lunch at 12:00 on 2024-05-19, I need to get the events scheduled for that specific date. I will first call the function to fetch the appointments on that date. After that, if she is free, I can proceed to create the calendar event for lunch with Sarah.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_day_calendar_events(day="2024-05-19")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

<function_thought>
Emma has two scheduled events on 2024-05-19:
1. "Project Kick-off" from 10:00 to 11:00
2. "One-on-One with Manager" from 11:00 to 11:30

This indicates that she is busy until 11:30, which conflicts with the proposed lunch at 12:00. Therefore, she is not free for lunch at that time, and I don't need to create the event.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[]</function_call>

<final_answer>
Emma is not free for lunch at 12:00 on 2024-05-19 due to prior appointments.
</final_answer>
